forceRepoSecretScanning.description: Enforces secret scanning job for a repo where AdvSec is already enabled.

dependabotEnabled.description: True if Dependabot is enabled for the repository, false if it is disabled.

enabled.description: Enabled status 0 disabled, 1 enabled, Null never explicitly set, always whatever project is, ya this should probably be an enum somewhere

options.description: Options that can be added during enablement (i.e. force secret scanning job to run)

repositoryId.description: RepositoryId Actual RepositoryId to Modify or Magic Repository Id "FFFFFFFF-FFFF-FFFF-FFFF-FFFFFFFFFFFF" for ALL Repositories for that project

id.description: Id of associated the work item.

url.description: REST Url of the work item.

Attachment.description: Meta data for a file attached to an artifact.

author.description: The person that uploaded this attachment.

contentHash.description: Content hash of on-disk representation of file content. Its calculated by the server by using SHA1 hash function.

createdDate.description: The time the attachment was uploaded.

displayName.description: The display name of the attachment. Can't be null or empty.

url.description: The url to download the content of the attachment.

AutoCompleteUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for an auto-complete update on a pull request

BillableCommitter.description: Used by AdvSec to return billable committers.

projectId.description: Project Id commit was pushed to.

projectName.description: Project name commit was pushed to.

pushedTime.description: Time of the push that contained the commit.

pushId.description: Push Id that contained the commit.

repoName.description: Repository name commit was pushed to.

BillablePusher.description: Used by AdvSec to estimate billable pushers for a Host or Project.

BranchUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a source/target branch update on a pull request

isSourceUpdate.description: If true, the source branch of the pull request was updated

changeType.description: The type of change that was made to the item.

newContent.description: Content of the item after the change.

sourceServerItem.description: Path of the item on the server.

ChangeListSearchCriteria.description: Criteria used in a search for change lists

compareVersion.description: If provided, a version descriptor to compare against base

excludeDeletes.description: If true, don't include delete history entries

followRenames.description: Whether or not to follow renames for the given item being queried

fromDate.description: If provided, only include history entries created after this date (string)

fromVersion.description: If provided, a version descriptor for the earliest change list to include

itemPath.description: Path of item to search under. If the itemPaths memebr is used then it will take precedence over this.

itemPaths.description: List of item paths to search under. If this member is used then itemPath will be ignored.

itemVersion.description: Version of the items to search

skip.description: Number of results to skip (used when clicking more...)

toDate.description: If provided, only include history entries created before this date (string)

top.description: If provided, the maximum number of history entries to return

toVersion.description: If provided, a version descriptor for the latest change list to include

user.description: Alias or display name of user who made the changes

Comment.description: Represents a comment which is one of potentially many in a comment thread.

commentType.description: The comment type at the time of creation.

values.description: The comment type is not known.
This is a regular user comment.
The comment comes as a result of a code change.
The comment represents a system message.

id.description: The comment ID. IDs start at 1 and are unique to a pull request.

isDeleted.description: Whether or not this comment was soft-deleted.

lastContentUpdatedDate.description: The date the comment's content was last updated.

lastUpdatedDate.description: The date the comment was last updated.

parentCommentId.description: The ID of the parent comment. This is used for replies.

publishedDate.description: The date the comment was first published.

usersLiked.description: A list of the users who have liked this comment.

CommentIterationContext.description: Comment iteration context is used to identify which diff was being viewed when the thread was created.

firstComparingIteration.description: The iteration of the file on the left side of the diff when the thread was created. If this value is equal to SecondComparingIteration, then this version is the common commit between the source and target branches of the pull request.

secondComparingIteration.description: The iteration of the file on the right side of the diff when the thread was created.

line.description: The line number of a thread's position. Starts at 1.

offset.description: The character offset of a thread's position inside of a line. Starts at 1.

CommentThread.description: Represents a comment thread of a pull request. A thread contains meta data about the file it was left on along with one or more comments (an initial comment and the subsequent replies).

identities.description: Set of identities related to this thread

isDeleted.description: Specify if the thread is deleted which happens when all comments are deleted.

lastUpdatedDate.description: The time this thread was last updated.

properties.description: Optional properties associated with the thread as a collection of key-value pairs.

publishedDate.description: The time this thread was published.

status.description: The status of the comment thread.

values.description: The thread status is unknown.
The thread status is active.
The thread status is resolved as fixed.
The thread status is resolved as won't fix.
The thread status is closed.
The thread status is resolved as by design.
The thread status is pending.

threadContext.description: Specify thread context such as position in left/right file.

filePath.description: File path relative to the root of the repository. It's up to the client to use any path format.

leftFileEnd.description: Position of last character of the thread's span in left file.

leftFileStart.description: Position of first character of the thread's span in left file.

rightFileEnd.description: Position of last character of the thread's span in right file.

rightFileStart.description: Position of first character of the thread's span in right file.

CommentTrackingCriteria.description: Comment tracking criteria is used to identify which iteration context the thread has been tracked to (if any) along with some detail about the original position and filename.

firstComparingIteration.description: The iteration of the file on the left side of the diff that the thread will be tracked to. Threads were tracked if this is greater than 0.

origFilePath.description: Original filepath the thread was created on before tracking. This will be different than the current thread filepath if the file in question was renamed in a later iteration.

origLeftFileEnd.description: Original position of last character of the thread's span in left file.

origLeftFileStart.description: Original position of first character of the thread's span in left file.

origRightFileEnd.description: Original position of last character of the thread's span in right file.

origRightFileStart.description: Original position of first character of the thread's span in right file.

secondComparingIteration.description: The iteration of the file on the right side of the diff that the thread will be tracked to. Threads were tracked if this is greater than 0.

CompletionErrorsEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a completion errors on a pull request

errorMessage.description: The error message associated with the completion error

DiscussionsUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a discussions update on a pull request

FileDiff.description: Provides properties that describe file differences

lineDiffBlocks.description: The collection of line diff blocks

originalPath.description: Original path of item if different from current path.

FileDiffParams.description: Provides parameters that describe inputs for the file diff

FileDiffsCriteria.description: Provides properties that describe inputs for the file diffs

baseVersionCommit.description: Commit ID of the base version

fileDiffParams.description: List of parameters for each of the files for which we need to get the file diff

targetVersionCommit.description: Commit ID of the target version

name.description: The name of the annotated tag.

taggedBy.description: User info and date of tagging.

values.description: The operation is waiting in a queue and has not yet started.
The operation is currently in progress.
The operation has completed.
The operation has failed. Check for an error message.
The operation has been abandoned.

url.description: A URL that can be used to make further requests for status about the operation

GitAsyncRefOperationDetail.description: Information about the progress of a cherry pick or revert operation.

conflict.description: Indicates if there was a conflict generated when trying to cherry pick or revert the changes.

currentCommitId.description: The current commit from the list of commits that are being cherry picked or reverted.

failureMessage.description: Detailed information about why the cherry pick or revert failed to complete.

progress.description: A number between 0 and 1 indicating the percent complete of the operation.

status.description: Provides a status code that indicates the reason the cherry pick or revert failed.

values.description: No status
Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because the ref name presented in the request was not valid.
The ref update could not be completed because, in case-insensitive mode, the ref name conflicts with an existing, differently-cased ref name.
The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks the permission to create a branch
The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks write permissions required to write this ref
Target branch was deleted after Git async operation started
Git object is too large to materialize into memory
Identity who authorized the operation was not found
Async operation was not found
Unexpected failure
Initiator of async operation has signature with empty name or email

timedout.description: Indicates if the operation went beyond the maximum time allowed for a cherry pick or revert operation.

GitAsyncRefOperationParameters.description: Parameters that are provided in the request body when requesting to cherry pick or revert.

generatedRefName.description: Proposed target branch name for the cherry pick or revert operation.

ontoRefName.description: The target branch for the cherry pick or revert operation.

repository.description: The git repository for the cherry pick or revert operation.

source.description: Details about the source of the cherry pick or revert operation (e.g. A pull request or a specific commit).

GitAsyncRefOperationSource.description: GitAsyncRefOperationSource specifies the pull request or list of commits to use when making a cherry pick and revert operation request. Only one should be provided.

commitList.description: A list of commits to cherry pick or revert

pullRequestId.description: Id of the pull request to cherry pick or revert

baseVersion.description: Version string identifier (name of tag/branch, SHA1 of commit)

baseVersionOptions.description: Version options - Specify additional modifiers to version (e.g Previous)

values.description: Not specified
Commit that changed item prior to the current version
First parent of commit (HEAD^)

baseVersionType.description: Version type (branch, tag, or commit). Determines how Id is interpreted

values.description: Interpret the version as a branch name
Interpret the version as a tag name
Interpret the version as a commit ID (SHA1)

GitBranchStats.description: Ahead and behind counts for a particular ref.

isBaseVersion.description: True if this is the result for the base version.

changeId.description: ID of the change within the group of changes.

newContentTemplate.description: New Content template to be used when pushing new changes.

originalPath.description: Original path of item if different from current path.

GitCherryPick.description: This object is returned from Cherry Pick operations and provides the id and status of the operation

GitCommitRef.description: Provides properties that describe a Git commit and associated metadata.

_links.description: A collection of related REST reference links.

changeCounts.description: Counts of the types of changes (edits, deletes, etc.) included with the commit.

changes.description: An enumeration of the changes included with the commit.

comment.description: Comment or message of the commit.

commentTruncated.description: Indicates if the comment is truncated from the full Git commit comment message.

commitTooManyChanges.description: Indicates that commit contains too many changes to be displayed

parents.description: An enumeration of the parent commit IDs for this commit.

push.description: The push associated with this commit.

remoteUrl.description: Remote URL path to the commit.

statuses.description: A list of status metadata from services and extensions that may associate additional information to the commit.

workItems.description: A list of workitems associated with this commit.

values.description: No conflict
Added on source and target; content differs
Added on source and rename destination on target
Deleted on source and edited on target
Deleted on source and renamed on target
Path is a directory on source and a file on target
Children of directory which has DirectoryFile or FileDirectory conflict
Edited on source and deleted on target
Edited on source and target; content differs
Path is a file on source and a directory on target
Same file renamed on both source and target; destination paths differ
Different files renamed to same destination path on both source and target
Rename destination on source and new file on target
Renamed on source and deleted on target
Rename destination on both source and target; content differs
No error
User set a blob id for resolving a content merge, but blob was not found in repo during application
Attempted to resolve a conflict by moving a file to another path, but path was already in use
No error
GitResolutionAction was set to an unrecognized value
GitResolutionMergeType was set to an unrecognized value
Any error for which a more specific code doesn't apply

conflictId.description: Conflict ID that was provided by input

updatedConflict.description: New state of the conflict after updating

updateStatus.description: Status of the update on the server

values.description: Indicates that pull request conflict update request was completed successfully
Indicates that the update request did not fit the expected data contract
Indicates that the requested resolution was not valid
Indicates that the conflict in the update request was not a supported conflict type
Indicates that the conflict could not be found

GitForkOperationStatusDetail.description: Status information about a requested fork operation.

allSteps.description: All valid steps for the forking process

currentStep.description: Index into AllSteps for the current step

errorMessage.description: Error message if the operation failed.

repository.description: The repository ID of the fork.

GitForkSyncRequest.description: Request to sync data between two forks.

source.description: Fully-qualified identifier for the source repository.

sourceToTargetRefs.description: If supplied, the set of ref mappings to use when performing a "sync" or create. If missing, all refs will be synchronized.

values.description: The operation is waiting in a queue and has not yet started.
The operation is currently in progress.
The operation has completed.
The operation has failed. Check for an error message.
The operation has been abandoned.

GitForkSyncRequestParameters.description: Parameters for creating a fork request

source.description: Fully-qualified identifier for the source repository.

sourceToTargetRefs.description: If supplied, the set of ref mappings to use when performing a "sync" or create. If missing, all refs will be synchronized.

GitImportGitSource.description: Parameter for creating a git import request when source is Git version control

overwrite.description: Tells if this is a sync request or not

GitImportRequest.description: A request to import data from a remote source control system.

detailedStatus.description: Detailed status of the import, including the current step and an error message, if applicable.

importRequestId.description: The unique identifier for this import request.

parameters.description: Parameters for creating the import request.

repository.description: The target repository for this import.

values.description: The operation is waiting in a queue and has not yet started.
The operation is currently in progress.
The operation has completed.
The operation has failed. Check for an error message.
The operation has been abandoned.

url.description: A link back to this import request resource.

GitImportRequestParameters.description: Parameters for creating an import request

deleteServiceEndpointAfterImportIsDone.description: Option to delete service endpoint when import is done

serviceEndpointId.description: Service Endpoint for connection to external endpoint

GitImportStatusDetail.description: Additional status information about an import request.

allSteps.description: All valid steps for the import process

currentStep.description: Index into AllSteps for the current step

errorMessage.description: Error message if the operation failed.

GitImportTfvcSource.description: Parameter for creating a git import request when source is tfvc version control

importHistory.description: Set true to import History, false otherwise

importHistoryDurationInDays.description: Get history for last n days (max allowed value is 180 days)

path.description: Path which we want to import (this can be copied from Path Control in Explorer)

commitId.description: SHA1 of commit item was fetched at

gitObjectType.description: Type of object (Commit, Tree, Blob, Tag, ...)

latestProcessedChange.description: Shallow ref to commit that last changed this item Only populated if latestProcessedChange is requested May not be accurate if latest change is not yet cached

recursionLevel.description: Specifies whether to include children (OneLevel), all descendants (Full), or None

values.description: Only return the specified item.
Return the specified item and its direct children.
Return the specified item and its direct children, as well as recursive chains of nested child folders that only contain a single folder.
Return specified item and all descendants

version.description: Version string (interpretation based on VersionType defined in subclass

values.description: Not specified
Commit that changed item prior to the current version
First parent of commit (HEAD^)
Interpret the version as a branch name
Interpret the version as a tag name
Interpret the version as a commit ID (SHA1)

includeContentMetadata.description: Whether to include metadata for all items

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

itemDescriptors.description: Collection of items to fetch, including path, version, and recursion level

latestProcessedChange.description: Whether to include shallow ref to commit that last changed each item

commitId.description: Gets or sets the commit Id this item was modified most recently for the provided version.

path.description: Gets or sets the path of the item.

commits.description: The list of commits referenced by Items, if they were requested.

lastExploredTime.description: The last explored time, in case the result is not comprehensive. Null otherwise.

detailedStatus.description: Detailed status of the merge operation.

mergeOperationId.description: Unique identifier for the merge operation.

values.description: The operation is waiting in a queue and has not yet started.
The operation is currently in progress.
The operation has completed.
The operation has failed. Check for an error message.
The operation has been abandoned.

GitMergeOperationStatusDetail.description: Status information about a requested merge operation.

failureMessage.description: Error message if the operation failed.

mergeCommitId.description: The commitId of the resultant merge commit.

GitMergeParameters.description: Parameters required for performing git merge.

comment.description: Comment or message of the commit.

parents.description: An enumeration of the parent commit IDs for the merge  commit.

GitObject.description: Git object identifier and type information.

objectType.description: Type of object (Commit, Tree, Blob, Tag)

continuationToken.description: The HTTP client methods find the continuation token header in the response and populate this field.

GitPullRequest.description: Represents all the data associated with a pull request.

artifactId.description: A string which uniquely identifies this pull request. To generate an artifact ID for a pull request, use this template: ```vstfs:///Git/PullRequestId/{projectId}/{repositoryId}/{pullRequestId}```

autoCompleteSetBy.description: If set, auto-complete is enabled for this pull request and this is the identity that enabled it.

closedBy.description: The user who closed the pull request.

closedDate.description: The date when the pull request was closed (completed, abandoned, or merged externally).

codeReviewId.description: The code review ID of the pull request. Used internally.

commits.description: The commits contained in the pull request.

completionOptions.description: Options which affect how the pull request will be merged when it is completed.

completionQueueTime.description: The most recent date at which the pull request entered the queue to be completed. Used internally.

createdBy.description: The identity of the user who created the pull request.

creationDate.description: The date when the pull request was created.

description.description: The description of the pull request.

forkSource.description: If this is a PR from a fork this will contain information about its source.

ignoreTargetRefAndChooseDynamically.description: This optional parameter allows clients to use server-side dynamic choices for the target ref. Due to preexisting contracts, users _must_ specify a target ref, but this option will cause the server to ignore it and choose dynamically from the user's favorites (or the default branch).

labels.description: The labels associated with the pull request.

lastMergeCommit.description: The commit of the most recent pull request merge. If empty, the most recent merge is in progress or was unsuccessful.

lastMergeSourceCommit.description: The commit at the head of the source branch at the time of the last pull request merge.

lastMergeTargetCommit.description: The commit at the head of the target branch at the time of the last pull request merge.

mergeFailureMessage.description: If set, pull request merge failed for this reason.

mergeFailureType.description: The type of failure (if any) of the pull request merge.

values.description: Type is not set. Default type.
Pull request merge failure type unknown.
Pull request merge failed due to case mismatch.
Pull request merge failed due to an object being too large.

mergeId.description: The ID of the job used to run the pull request merge. Used internally.

mergeOptions.description: Options used when the pull request merge runs. These are separate from completion options since completion happens only once and a new merge will run every time the source branch of the pull request changes.

mergeStatus.description: The current status of the pull request merge.

values.description: Status is not set. Default state.
Pull request merge is queued.
Pull request merge failed due to conflicts.
Pull request merge succeeded.
Pull request merge rejected by policy.
Pull request merge failed.

pullRequestId.description: The ID of the pull request.

repository.description: The repository containing the target branch of the pull request.

reviewers.description: A list of reviewers on the pull request along with the state of their votes.

sourceRefName.description: The name of the source branch of the pull request.

status.description: The status of the pull request.

values.description: Status not set. Default state.
Pull request is active.
Pull request is abandoned.
Pull request is completed.
Used in pull request search criteria to include all statuses.

supportsIterations.description: If true, this pull request supports multiple iterations. Iteration support means individual pushes to the source branch of the pull request can be reviewed and comments left in one iteration will be tracked across future iterations.

targetRefName.description: The name of the target branch of the pull request.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

workItemRefs.description: Any work item references associated with this pull request.

GitPullRequestChange.description: Change made in a pull request.

changeTrackingId.description: ID used to track files through multiple changes.

GitPullRequestCommentThread.description: Represents a comment thread of a pull request. A thread contains meta data about the file it was left on (if any) along with one or more comments (an initial comment and the subsequent replies).

pullRequestThreadContext.description: Extended context information unique to pull requests

GitPullRequestCommentThreadContext.description: Comment thread context contains details about what diffs were being viewed at the time of thread creation and whether or not the thread has been tracked from that original diff.

changeTrackingId.description: Used to track a comment across iterations. This value can be found by looking at the iteration's changes list. Must be set for pull requests with iteration support. Otherwise, it's not required for 'legacy' pull requests.

iterationContext.description: The iteration context being viewed when the thread was created.

trackingCriteria.description: The criteria used to track this thread. If this property is filled out when the thread is returned, then the thread has been tracked from its original location using the given criteria.

GitPullRequestCompletionOptions.description: Preferences about how the pull request should be completed.

autoCompleteIgnoreConfigIds.description: List of any policy configuration Id's which auto-complete should not wait for. Only applies to optional policies (isBlocking == false). Auto-complete always waits for required policies (isBlocking == true).

bypassPolicy.description: If true, policies will be explicitly bypassed while the pull request is completed.

bypassReason.description: If policies are bypassed, this reason is stored as to why bypass was used.

deleteSourceBranch.description: If true, the source branch of the pull request will be deleted after completion.

mergeCommitMessage.description: If set, this will be used as the commit message of the merge commit.

mergeStrategy.description: Specify the strategy used to merge the pull request during completion. If MergeStrategy is not set to any value, a no-FF merge will be created if SquashMerge == false. If MergeStrategy is not set to any value, the pull request commits will be squashed if SquashMerge == true. The SquashMerge property is deprecated. It is recommended that you explicitly set MergeStrategy in all cases. If an explicit value is provided for MergeStrategy, the SquashMerge property will be ignored.

values.description: A two-parent, no-fast-forward merge. The source branch is unchanged. This is the default behavior.
Put all changes from the pull request into a single-parent commit.
Rebase the source branch on top of the target branch HEAD commit, and fast-forward the target branch. The source branch is updated during the rebase operation.
Rebase the source branch on top of the target branch HEAD commit, and create a two-parent, no-fast-forward merge. The source branch is updated during the rebase operation.

squashMerge.description: SquashMerge is deprecated. You should explicitly set the value of MergeStrategy. If MergeStrategy is set to any value, the SquashMerge value will be ignored. If MergeStrategy is not set, the merge strategy will be no-fast-forward if this flag is false, or squash if true.

transitionWorkItems.description: If true, we will attempt to transition any work items linked to the pull request into the next logical state (i.e. Active -> Resolved)

triggeredByAutoComplete.description: If true, the current completion attempt was triggered via auto-complete. Used internally.

GitPullRequestIteration.description: Provides properties that describe a Git pull request iteration. Iterations are created as a result of creating and pushing updates to a pull request.

_links.description: A collection of related REST reference links.

author.description: Author of the pull request iteration.

changeList.description: Changes included with the pull request iteration.

commits.description: The commits included with the pull request iteration.

commonRefCommit.description: The first common Git commit of the source and target refs.

createdDate.description: The creation date of the pull request iteration.

description.description: Description of the pull request iteration.

hasMoreCommits.description: Indicates if the Commits property contains a truncated list of commits in this pull request iteration.

id.description: ID of the pull request iteration. Iterations are created as a result of creating and pushing updates to a pull request.

newTargetRefName.description: If the iteration reason is Retarget, this is the refName of the new target

oldTargetRefName.description: If the iteration reason is Retarget, this is the original target refName

push.description: The Git push information associated with this pull request iteration.

reason.description: The reason for which the pull request iteration was created.

sourceRefCommit.description: The source Git commit of this iteration.

targetRefCommit.description: The target Git commit of this iteration.

updatedDate.description: The updated date of the pull request iteration.

GitPullRequestIterationChanges.description: Collection of changes made in a pull request.

nextSkip.description: Value to specify as skip to get the next page of changes.  This will be zero if there are no more changes.

nextTop.description: Value to specify as top to get the next page of changes.  This will be zero if there are no more changes.

GitPullRequestMergeOptions.description: The options which are used when a pull request merge is created.

conflictAuthorshipCommits.description: If true, conflict resolutions applied during the merge will be put in separate commits to preserve authorship info for git blame, etc.

detectRenameFalsePositives.description: If true, renames where there is more than one valid way to map the original file locations to renamed file locations will be treated as false positives and ignored.

disableRenames.description: If true, rename detection will not be performed during the merge.

GitPullRequestQuery.description: A set of pull request queries and their results.

results.description: The results of the queries. This matches the QueryInputs list so Results[n] are the results of QueryInputs[n]. Each entry in the list is a dictionary of commit->pull requests.

items.description: The list of commit IDs to search for.

type.description: The type of query to perform.

values.description: No query type set.
Search for pull requests that created the supplied merge commits.
Search for pull requests that merged the supplied commits.

shA1Hash.description: Content hash of on-disk representation of file content. Its calculated by the client by using SHA1 hash function. Ensure that uploaded file has same encoding as in source control.

GitPullRequestSearchCriteria.description: Pull requests can be searched for matching this criteria.

creatorId.description: If set, search for pull requests that were created by this identity.

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

maxTime.description: If specified, filters pull requests that created/closed before this date based on the queryTimeRangeType specified.

minTime.description: If specified, filters pull requests that created/closed after this date based on the queryTimeRangeType specified.

queryTimeRangeType.description: The type of time range which should be used for minTime and maxTime. Defaults to Created if unset.

values.description: The date when the pull request was created.
The date when the pull request was closed (completed, abandoned, or merged externally).

repositoryId.description: If set, search for pull requests whose target branch is in this repository.

reviewerId.description: If set, search for pull requests that have this identity as a reviewer.

sourceRefName.description: If set, search for pull requests from this branch.

sourceRepositoryId.description: If set, search for pull requests whose source branch is in this repository.

status.description: If set, search for pull requests that are in this state. Defaults to Active if unset.

values.description: Status not set. Default state.
Pull request is active.
Pull request is abandoned.
Pull request is completed.
Used in pull request search criteria to include all statuses.

targetRefName.description: If set, search for pull requests into this branch.

GitPullRequestStatus.description: This class contains the metadata of a service/extension posting pull request status. Status can be associated with a pull request or an iteration.

iterationId.description: ID of the iteration to associate status with. Minimum value is 1.

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

$top.description: Maximum number of entries to retrieve

author.description: Alias or display name of the author

compareVersion.description: Only applicable when ItemVersion specified. If provided, start walking history starting at this commit.

excludeDeletes.description: Only applies when an itemPath is specified. This determines whether to exclude delete entries of the specified path.

fromCommitId.description: If provided, a lower bound for filtering commits alphabetically

fromDate.description: If provided, only include history entries created after this date (string)

historyMode.description: What Git history mode should be used. This only applies to the search criteria when Ids = null and an itemPath is specified.

values.description: The history mode used by `git log`. This is the default.
The history mode used by `git log --first-parent`
The history mode used by `git log --full-history`
The history mode used by `git log --full-history --simplify-merges`

ids.description: If provided, specifies the exact commit ids of the commits to fetch. May not be combined with other parameters.

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

includePushData.description: Whether to include the push information

includeUserImageUrl.description: Whether to include the image Url for committers and authors

includeWorkItems.description: Whether to include linked work items

itemPath.description: Path of item to search under

itemVersion.description: If provided, identifies the commit or branch to search

showOldestCommitsFirst.description: If enabled, this option will ignore the itemVersion and compareVersion parameters

toCommitId.description: If provided, an upper bound for filtering commits alphabetically

toDate.description: If provided, only include history entries created before this date (string)

user.description: Alias or display name of the committer

commitIds.description: List of commit Ids to be searched

refNames.description: List of complete or partial names for refs to be searched

searchType.description: Type of search on refNames, if provided

deleted.description: Setting to false will undo earlier deletion and restore the repository.

customMessage.description: Custom message for the result object For instance, Reason for failing.

isLocked.description: Whether the ref is locked or not

rejectedBy.description: Name of the plugin that rejected the updated.

success.description: True if the ref update succeeded, false otherwise

updateStatus.description: Status of the update from the TFS server.

values.description: Indicates that the ref update request was completed successfully.
Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because part of the graph would be disconnected by this change, and the caller does not have ForcePush permission on the repository.

Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because the old object ID presented in the request was not the object ID of the ref when the database attempted the update. The most likely scenario is that the caller lost a race to update the ref.
Indicates that the ref update request could not be completed because the ref name presented in the request was not valid.
The request was not processed
The ref update request could not be completed because the new object ID for the ref could not be resolved to a commit object (potentially through any number of tags)
The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks write permissions required to write this ref
The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks note creation permissions required to write this note
The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks the permission to create a branch
The ref update request could not be completed because the user lacks the permission to create a tag
The ref update could not be completed because it was rejected by the plugin.
The ref update could not be completed because the ref is locked by another user.
The ref update could not be completed because, in case-insensitive mode, the ref name conflicts with an existing, differently-cased ref name.
The ref update could not be completed because it was rejected by policy.
Indicates that the ref update request was completed successfully, but the ref doesn't actually exist so no changes were made.  This should only happen during deletes.
Indicates that the ref update request was completed successfully, but the passed-in ref was corrupt - as in, the old object ID was bad.  This should only happen during deletes.

isDisabled.description: True if the repository is disabled. False otherwise.

isFork.description: True if the repository was created as a fork.

isInMaintenance.description: True if the repository is in maintenance. False otherwise.

collection.description: Team Project Collection where this Fork resides

isFork.description: True if the repository was created as a fork

GitStatus.description: This class contains the metadata of a service/extension posting a status.

creationDate.description: Creation date and time of the status.

description.description: Status description. Typically describes current state of the status.

values.description: Status state not set. Default state.
Status pending.
Status succeeded.
Status failed.
Status with an error.
Status is not applicable to the target object.
Status Partially Succeeded, build finished with warnings.

updatedDate.description: Last update date and time of the status.

GitStatusContext.description: Status context that uniquely identifies the status.

genre.description: Genre of the status. Typically name of the service/tool generating the status, can be empty.

name.description: Name identifier of the status, cannot be null or empty.

GitSuggestion.description: An object describing the git suggestion.  Git suggestions are currently limited to suggested pull requests.

type.description: The type of suggestion (e.g. pull request).

targetVersion.description: Version string identifier (name of tag/branch, SHA1 of commit)

targetVersionOptions.description: Version options - Specify additional modifiers to version (e.g Previous)

values.description: Not specified
Commit that changed item prior to the current version
First parent of commit (HEAD^)

targetVersionType.description: Version type (branch, tag, or commit). Determines how Id is interpreted

values.description: Interpret the version as a branch name
Interpret the version as a tag name
Interpret the version as a commit ID (SHA1)

baseTreeId.description: ObjectId of the base tree of this diff.

diffEntries.description: List of tree entries that differ between the base and target tree.  Renames and object type changes are returned as a delete for the old object and add for the new object.  If a continuation token is returned in the response header, some tree entries are yet to be processed and may yield more diff entries. If the continuation token is not returned all the diff entries have been included in this response.

targetTreeId.description: ObjectId of the target tree of this diff.

baseObjectId.description: SHA1 hash of the object in the base tree, if it exists. Will be null in case of adds.

changeType.description: Type of change that affected this entry.

objectType.description: Object type of the tree entry. Blob, Tree or Commit("submodule")

path.description: Relative path in base and target trees.

targetObjectId.description: SHA1 hash of the object in the target tree, if it exists. Will be null in case of deletes.

continuationToken.description: The HTTP client methods find the continuation token header in the response and populate this field.

relativePath.description: Path relative to parent tree object

url.description: url to retrieve tree or blob

size.description: Sum of sizes of all children

treeEntries.description: Blobs and trees under this tree

GitUserDate.description: User info and date for Git operations.

email.description: Email address of the user performing the Git operation.

name.description: Name of the user performing the Git operation.

version.description: Version string identifier (name of tag/branch, SHA1 of commit)

versionOptions.description: Version options - Specify additional modifiers to version (e.g Previous)

values.description: Not specified
Commit that changed item prior to the current version
First parent of commit (HEAD^)

versionType.description: Version type (branch, tag, or commit). Determines how Id is interpreted

values.description: Interpret the version as a branch name
Interpret the version as a tag name
Interpret the version as a commit ID (SHA1)

GlobalGitRepositoryKey.description: Globally unique key for a repository.

collectionId.description: Team Project Collection ID of the collection for the repository.

projectId.description: Team Project ID of the project for the repository.

_links.description: This field contains zero or more interesting links about the graph subject. These links may be invoked to obtain additional relationships or more detailed information about this graph subject.

descriptor.description: The descriptor is the primary way to reference the graph subject while the system is running. This field will uniquely identify the same graph subject across both Accounts and Organizations.

displayName.description: This is the non-unique display name of the graph subject. To change this field, you must alter its value in the source provider.

url.description: This url is the full route to the source resource of this graph subject.

changeList.description: The Change list (changeset/commit/shelveset) for this point in history

itemChangeType.description: The change made to the item from this change list (only relevant for File history, not folders)

serverItem.description: The path of the item at this point in history (only relevant for File history, not folders)

directoryAlias.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph user referenced in the "self" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

imageUrl.description: Deprecated - Available in the "avatar" entry of the IdentityRef "_links" dictionary

inactive.description: Deprecated - Can be retrieved by querying the Graph membership state referenced in the "membershipState" entry of the GraphUser "_links" dictionary

isAadIdentity.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsAadUserType/Descriptor.IsAadGroupType)

isContainer.description: Deprecated - Can be inferred from the subject type of the descriptor (Descriptor.IsGroupType)

profileUrl.description: Deprecated - not in use in most preexisting implementations of ToIdentityRef

IdentityRefWithVote.description: Identity information including a vote on a pull request.

hasDeclined.description: Indicates if this reviewer has declined to review this pull request.

isFlagged.description: Indicates if this reviewer is flagged for attention on this pull request.

isReapprove.description: Indicates if this approve vote should still be handled even though vote didn't change.

isRequired.description:
Indicates if this is a required reviewer for this pull request.
Branches can have policies that require particular reviewers are required for pull requests.

reviewerUrl.description: URL to retrieve information about this identity

vote.description:
Vote on a pull request:
10 - approved 5 - approved with suggestions 0 - no vote -5 - waiting for author -10 - rejected

votedFor.description:
Groups or teams that this reviewer contributed to.
Groups and teams can be reviewers on pull requests but can not vote directly. When a member of the group or team votes, that vote is rolled up into the group or team vote. VotedFor is a list of such votes.

IsDraftUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for IsDraft update on a pull request

ItemDetailsOptions.description: Optional details to include when returning an item model

includeContentMetadata.description: If true, include metadata about the file type

recursionLevel.description: Specifies whether to include children (OneLevel), all descendants (Full) or None for folder items

values.description: Only return the specified item.
Return the specified item and its direct children.
Return the specified item and its direct children, as well as recursive chains of nested child folders that only contain a single folder.
Return specified item and all descendants

LabelsUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for updated labels on a pull request

LineDiffBlock.description: The class to represent the line diff block

changeType.description: Type of change that was made to the block.

values.description: No change - both the blocks are identical
Lines were added to the block in the modified file
Lines were deleted from the block in the original file
Lines were modified

modifiedLineNumberStart.description: Line number where this block starts in modified file.

modifiedLinesCount.description: Count of lines in this block in modified file.

originalLineNumberStart.description: Line number where this block starts in original file.

originalLinesCount.description: Count of lines in this block in original file.

MergeCompletedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a merge completed on a pull request

PolicyConfiguration.description: The full policy configuration with settings.

_links.description: The links to other objects related to this object.

createdBy.description: A reference to the identity that created the policy.

createdDate.description: The date and time when the policy was created.

isBlocking.description: Indicates whether the policy is blocking.

isDeleted.description: Indicates whether the policy has been (soft) deleted.

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether the policy is enabled.

isEnterpriseManaged.description: If set, this policy requires "Manage Enterprise Policies" permission to create, edit, or delete.

url.description: The URL where the policy configuration can be retrieved.

PolicyEvaluationUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a policy evaluation update on a pull request

displayName.description: Display name of the policy type.

url.description: The URL where the policy type can be retrieved.

PropertiesCollection.description: The class represents a property bag as a collection of key-value pairs. Values of all primitive types (any type with a `TypeCode != TypeCode.Object`) except for `DBNull` are accepted. Values of type Byte[], Int32, Double, DateType and String preserve their type, other primitives are retuned as a String. Byte[] expected as base64 encoded string.

count.description: The count of properties in the collection.

keys.description: The set of keys in the collection.

values.description: The set of values in the collection.

PullRequestCreatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for pull request creation

PullRequestTabExtensionConfig.description: Initial config contract sent to extensions creating tabs on the pull request page

RealTimePullRequestEvent.description: Base contract for a real time pull request event (SignalR)

eventId.description: The id of this event. Can be used to track send/receive state between client and server.

pullRequestId.description: The id of the pull request this event was generated for.

ReferenceLinks.description: The class to represent a collection of REST reference links.

links.description: The readonly view of the links.  Because Reference links are readonly, we only want to expose them as read only.

RetargetEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for when the target branch of a pull request is changed

ReviewersUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for an update to reviewers on a pull request

ReviewersVotesResetEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for reviewer votes being reset on a pull request

ReviewerVoteUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a reviewer vote update on a pull request

ShareNotificationContext.description: Context used while sharing a pull request.

receivers.description: Identities of users who will receive a share notification.

sourceRef.description: The source ref to copy. For example, refs/heads/master.

targetRef.description: The target ref to update. For example, refs/heads/master.

StatusAddedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for an added status on a pull request

StatusesDeletedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for deleted statuses on a pull request

StatusUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a status update on a pull request

downloadUrl.description: The download URL for the IDE.

protocolHandlerUrl.description: The URL to open the protocol handler for the IDE.

TeamProjectReference.description: Represents a shallow reference to a TeamProject.

defaultTeamImageUrl.description: Url to default team identity image.

values.description: Project is in the process of being deleted.
Project is in the process of being created.
Project is completely created and ready to use.
Project has been queued for creation, but the process has not yet started.
All projects regardless of state except Deleted.
Project has not been changed.
Project has been deleted.

url.description: Url to the full version of the object.

values.description: The project is only visible to users with explicit access.
The project is visible to all.

children.description: List of children for the branch.

relatedBranches.description: List of paths of the related branches.

_links.description: A collection of REST reference links.

owner.description: Alias or display name of user

mergeSources.description: List of merge sources in case of rename or branch creation.

pendingVersion.description: Version at which a (shelved) change was pended against

accountId.description: Changeset Account Id also known as Organization Id.

checkinNotes.description: List of Checkin Notes for the changeset.

hasMoreChanges.description: True if more changes are available.

teamProjectIds.description: Team Project Ids for the changeset.

workItems.description: List of work items associated with the changeset.

_links.description: A collection of REST reference links.

author.description: Alias or display name of user.

checkedInBy.description: Alias or display name of user.

TfvcChangesetSearchCriteria.description: Criteria used in a search for change lists.

author.description: Alias or display name of user who made the changes.

followRenames.description: Whether or not to follow renames for the given item being queried.

fromDate.description: If provided, only include changesets created after this date (string).

fromId.description: If provided, only include changesets after this changesetID.

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references.

itemPath.description: Path of item to search under.

toDate.description: If provided, only include changesets created before this date (string).

toId.description: If provided, a version descriptor for the latest change list to include.

TfvcChangesetsRequestData.description: Request body for Get batched changesets.

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

encoding.description: The encoding of the item at this point in history (only relevant for File history, not folders)

fileId.description: The file id of the item at this point in history (only relevant for File history, not folders)

deletionId.description: Greater than 0 if item is deleted.

encoding.description: File encoding from database, -1 represents binary.

hashValue.description: MD5 hash as a base 64 string, applies to files only.

isBranch.description: True if item is a branch.

isPendingChange.description: True if there is a change pending.

size.description: The size of the file, if applicable.

TfvcItemDescriptor.description: Item path and Version descriptor properties

values.description: Only return the specified item.
Return the specified item and its direct children.
Return the specified item and its direct children, as well as recursive chains of nested child folders that only contain a single folder.
Return specified item and all descendants

version.description: Specify the desired version, can be null or empty string only if VersionType is latest or tip.

values.description: None.
Return the previous version.
Only usuable with versiontype MergeSource and integer versions, uses RenameSource identifier instead of Merge identifier.
Version is treated as a ChangesetId.
Version is treated as a ChangesetId.
Version is treated as a Shelveset name and owner.
Version is treated as a Change.
Version is treated as a Date.
If Version is defined the Latest of that Version will be used, if no version is defined the latest ChangesetId will be used.
Version will be treated as a Tip, if no version is defined latest will be used.
Version will be treated as a MergeSource.

TfvcItemPreviousHash.description: Metadata for an item including the previous hash value for files.

previousHashValue.description: MD5 hash as a base 64 string, applies to files only.

TfvcItemRequestData.description: Request body used by Get Items Batch

includeContentMetadata.description: If true, include metadata about the file type

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

modifiedDate.description: Last modified datetime for the label.

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references

TfvcMappingFilter.description: MappingFilter can be used to include or exclude specific paths.

exclude.description: True if ServerPath should be excluded.

serverPath.description: Path to be included or excluded.

isRename.description: Indicates if this a rename source. If false, it is a merge source.

serverItem.description: The server item of the merge source.

policyName.description: Name of the policy that failed.

policyFailures.description: Information on the failed policy that was overridden.

TfvcShallowBranchRef.description: This is the shallow branchref class.

_links.description: List of reference links for the shelveset.

includeDetails.description: Whether to include policyOverride and notes Only applies when requesting a single deep shelveset

includeLinks.description: Whether to include the _links field on the shallow references. Does not apply when requesting a single deep shelveset object. Links will always be included in the deep shelveset.

maxChangeCount.description: Max number of changes to include

owner.description: Owner's ID. Could be a name or a guid.

changesetId.description: Id of the last changeset the stats are based on.

fileCountTotal.description: Count of files at the requested scope.

values.description: None.
Return the previous version.
Only usuable with versiontype MergeSource and integer versions, uses RenameSource identifier instead of Merge identifier.
Version is treated as a ChangesetId.
Version is treated as a ChangesetId.
Version is treated as a Shelveset name and owner.
Version is treated as a Change.
Version is treated as a Date.
If Version is defined the Latest of that Version will be used, if no version is defined the latest ChangesetId will be used.
Version will be treated as a Tip, if no version is defined latest will be used.
Version will be treated as a MergeSource.

TitleDescriptionUpdatedEvent.description: Real time event (SignalR) for a title/description update on a pull request

values.description: Indicates the Git protocol model where any refs that can be updated will be updated, but any failures will not prevent other updates from succeeding.

Indicates that all ref updates must succeed or none will succeed. All ref updates will be atomically written. If any failure is encountered, previously successful updates will be rolled back and the entire operation will fail.

VersionedPolicyConfigurationRef.description: A particular revision for a policy configuration.

VssJsonCollectionWrapper.description: This class is used to serialize collections as a single JSON object on the wire.

WebApiTagDefinition.description: The representation of a tag definition which is sent across the wire.

active.description: Whether or not the tag definition is active.

name.description: The name of the tag definition.

url.description: Resource URL for the Tag Definition.

api-Version-preview.1.name: api-version
api-Version-preview.1.description: Version of the API to use.  This should be set to '7.2-preview.1' to use this version of the api.

accessToken.description: Personal access token. Use any value for the user name and the token as the password.
